item.description:
Folk music jam and Contra dance at the "music farmhouse" in Bethany. It is free, but you must bring food/dessert/wine/soda to share. The music is normally like 5 or 6 groups in different rooms jamming whatever they feel like...folk, country, blue grass, instrumental, Beatles, etc.

Contra dancing is around 10pm-12am. They keep it simple, and it gets a bit crowded, so it's not too athletic.

If you're a "Maybe" please say so in your RSVP

People of all ages are likely to be there...from 8 to 80. The vibe is generally a bit country/hippie.


Contra dancing is a "called" social folk dance descended from English and French country dancing. You will randomly pair up with people and constantly change partners all night, even mid-song. No experience needed, they walk you through what you need to do.  The footwork is basically just walking.  Preferably in time to the music, but even that isn't required.

HOST: Jason, cell # in my RSVP.  Texting is fine

PARKING: See their website for parking info.
http://www.bethanymusicanddance.com/

Or park on the nearby side-street (Hatfield Hill Rd)
item.name: Fri 9/28 - Free folk music jam & Contra dancing tonight
